contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|au|AU|Au|aŭ}} '''Au''', '''AU''' or '''au''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} ==Science== *[[Absorbance Units]], a reporting unit in spectroscopy *[[Astronomical unit]], an approximation for the average distance between the Earth and the Sun *[[Atomic units]], a system of units convenient for atomic physics and other fields *[[Gold]], a chemical element with the symbol Au *[[Arbitrary unit]], a relative placeholder unit for when the actual value of a measurement is unknown or unimportant ==Computing== *[[.au]], the internet country code for Australia *[[Au file format]], Sun Microsystems' audio format *[[Audio Units]], a system level plug-in architecture from Apple Computer *[[Adobe Audition]], a sound editor program. *[[Automatic Updates]], also known as Windows Update. ==Universities== *[[Aarhus University]], Arhus, Denmark *[[Aberystwyth University]], Aberystwyth, Wales, United Kingdom *[[Adelphi University]], Garden City, New York, United States *[[Air University (disambiguation)]], various locations *[[Aletheia University]], New Taipei City, Taiwan *[[Alfred University]], Alfred, New York, United States *[[Algoma University]], Sault Ste. Marie, Canada *[[Allahabad University]], Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India *[[American University]], Washington, D.C., United States *[[Anaheim University]], Anaheim, California, United States *[[Anderson University (Indiana)]], Anderson, Indiana, United States *[[Anderson University (South Carolina)]], Anderson, South Carolina, United States *[[Andhra University]], Visakhapatnam, AP, India *[[Andrews University]], Berrien Springs, Michigan, United States *[[Antioch University]], Culver City, California, United States *[[Apollos University]], Huntington Beach, California, United States *[[Arcadia University]], Glenside, Pennsylvania, United States *[[Arellano University]], Philippines *[[Argosy University]], Alameda, California, United States *[[Athabasca University]], Alberta, Canada *[[Auburn University]], Alabama, United States *[[Auckland University]], New Zealand *[[Aurora University]], Aurora, IL, United States ==Geography== *[[Australia]] *[[Au (Munich)]], Munich, Germany *[[Au (Schwarzwald)]], Baden-Württemberg, Germany *[[Au am Leithaberge]], Austria *[[Au am Rhein]], Germany *[[Au, Guinea]], Kankan Region *[[Au im Bregenzerwald]], Austria *[[Au in der Hallertau]], Germany *[[Au peninsula]], Switzerland *[[Au, St. Gallen]], Switzerland *[[Au, Vorarlberg]], Bregenz, Austria *[[Au, Zurich]], Switzerland == Organizations == *[[African Union]] *[[au (mobile phone company)]], a mobile phone company in Japan *[[Akademia Umiejętności]], a primary Polish scientific institution *[[Americans United for Separation of Church and State]] *[[Austral Líneas Aéreas]], IATA code ==Surname== * [[Au (surname)]], a Chinese family name ==Miscellaneous== * [[Au Co]], a fairy in Vietnamese mythology * [[Ab urbe condita]] (sometimes abbreviated as a.u.), Latin for "from the founding of the City" (Rome) * [[Alternative universe (fan fiction)]] * [[Athletic Union]], the union of sports clubs in a British university * [[Au (building)]], a building that has been squatted in Frankfurt, Germany * [[Aú]], a cartwheel in the Brazilian martial art of Capoeira * [[AU (band)]], an experimental pop group headed by Luke Wyland * ''Au'', a 2010 release by Scottish rock band [[Donaldson, Moir and Paterson]] * [[Ford AU Falcon]], a family car made in Australia * ''[[Alternative Ulster]]'', a music magazine * Vought AU, post-WWII US Marines variant of the [[F4U]] corsair {{disambiguation|school}}
